com.communote.server.core.blog.notes.processors

Class NoteStoringPreProcessorManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.blog.notes.processors.NoteStoringPreProcessorManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NoteStoringPreProcessorManager

    @Service(value="noteStoringPreProcessorManager")
public class NoteStoringPreProcessorManagerImpl
extends Object
implements NoteStoringPreProcessorManager
    Extension point for registering processors to manipulate notes before they are persisted. Typical use cases cover the extraction of meta data from the text and cleaning the DOM of content so that only supported tags and attributes are kept. This extension point respects the order value of the registered processors when calling them. Those with a higher order value will be called first.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

      • process

        public void process(NoteStoringTO noteStoringTO)
             throws NoteStoringPreProcessorException,
                    NoteManagementAuthorizationException
        Description copied from interface: NoteStoringPreProcessorManager
        Run the registered preprocessors before creating a new note. This will at first invoke the NoteStoringEditableContentPreProcessors and afterwards the NoteStoringImmutableContentPreProcessors.
        Specified by:
        process in interface NoteStoringPreProcessorManager
        Parameters:
        noteStoringTO - the TO to pass to the preprocessors
        Throws:
        NoteStoringPreProcessorException - in case any of the preprocessors failed
        NoteManagementAuthorizationException - thrown to indicate that the note cannot be created because of access restrictions

      • processEdit

        public void processEdit(Note noteToEdit,
                        NoteStoringTO noteStoringTO)
                 throws NoteStoringPreProcessorException,
                        NoteManagementAuthorizationException
        Description copied from interface: NoteStoringPreProcessorManager
        Run the registered preprocessors before updating an existing note. This will at first invoke the NoteStoringEditableContentPreProcessors and afterwards the NoteStoringImmutableContentPreProcessors.
        Specified by:
        processEdit in interface NoteStoringPreProcessorManager
        Parameters:
        noteToEdit - the note to edit
        noteStoringTO - the TO to pass to the preprocessors
        Throws:
        NoteStoringPreProcessorException - in case any of the preprocessors failed
        NoteManagementAuthorizationException - thrown to indicate that the note cannot be created because of access restrictions
